sub_title: International Education Consulting in PBIS & Restorative Practices and Student Wellness Programming
summary:
​Laura Mooiman, LCSW is an American based in The Netherlands who specializes in international educational consulting, training, and coaching in the areas of Positive Behavior Interventions and Supports (PBIS/MTSS), Restorative Practices, Wellness Centers, bullying and harassment prevention and response, and school crisis response.
She is a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) and adjunct faculty member at Saint Mary's College of California.  Laura holds a Masters in Social Work degree from University of California Los Angeles and has over 20 years’ experience in the US as a school district administrator, social worker in elementary, middle, and high schools, special education, County Probation, County Mental Health, Child Protective Services, and in Private Practice.  Most recently Laura was the Project Director for the Wellness Program and Positive Behavior Interventions and Support (PBIS) at Napa Valley Unified School District which was recognized for having some of the lowest suspension and expulsion rates and the highest school climate scores (CHKS) in the State of California.  Laura is a consultant for multiple NIH and IES research grants and a recipient of two US Congressional Recognitions for Outstanding Service to the Community in 2007 and 2015.

treasury_media.title: Wellness Program at Napa Valley Unified School District
treasury_media.description: An overview of the Wellness Program at Napa Valley Unified School District with Project Director Laura Mooiman

treasury_media.title: Mooiman Consulting
treasury_media.description: Would you like your school to be more positive, restorative, and safer?  Improve school culture and climate and reduce bullying through professional development.     Laura will train your school and district in Positive Behavior Interventions & Supports (PBIS), Restorative Practices, SWIS, and Wellness Centers using a Multi-Tiered System of Support (MTSS) framework.

treasury_media.title: NVUSD Wellness Centers 2017 Overview
treasury_media.description: Description of how Napa created Wellness Centers utilizing an MTSS model and only grant funding and community partners!

treasury_media.title: NVUSD PBIS Overview in Napa Valley Unified Schools
treasury_media.description: This is "NVUSD PBIS Overview" by NVUSD representing my work as Program Specialist for Positive Behavior Interventions and Supports from 2009 through the present.

awards.title: Special Congressional Recognition
awards.description: Prevention Champion Awards Certificate of Special Recognition - In recognition of efforts to prevent underage substance use in Napa County.  By Mike Thompson, Member of Congress

profile_positions.description: Laura provides professional development training, coaching, and consultation to schools wanting to improve school culture, student behavior or who are responding to a school crisis.  Services are focused on the areas of: Positive Behavior Interventions and Supports (PBIS/MTSS), Restorative Practices, Wellness Centers, school safety and violence prevention, bullying and harassment prevention and response to school crisis including death of a student, suicide, natural disasters, and allegations of child abuse.
profile_positions.title: Educational Consultant

profile_positions.description: As a faculty member of the Kalmanovitz School of Education I teach graduate courses in Positive Behavior Support I & II (SPED-282A & B).
profile_positions.title: Adjunct Professor

profile_positions.description: I coach all 30 NVUSD schools in Positive Behavior Interventions & Support (PBIS) and conduct district training for teachers, administrators, and classified staff in positive behavior support (BEST), writing Behavior Support Plans, Classroom Management, and new teacher orientation.  I contribute to decision making relative to the development of a continuum for district behavior interventions including Restorative Practices.  I have helped develop alternative education classrooms including those that serve emotionally disturbed and conduct disordered youth.  Through those efforts I collaborate with community agencies including Mental Health, Probation, Police, Child Protective Services. I participate on the district’s crisis management team and developed a School Grief Protocol for all schools to use.  I train and support all school sites in SWIS (Schoolwide Information Systems) and am a SWIS facilitator.
profile_positions.title: Program Specialist Positive Behavior Interventions & Supports

profile_positions.description:
•Developed and evaluated behavior interventions and social skill training for self contained classrooms for preschoolers and school aged children with Autism 
•Provided school wide trainings on Child Abuse Reporting and Positive Behavior Supports implementation (PBS)
•Provided individual and group therapy for students, completed social emotional portions of IEP
•Provided support and counseling for elementary and high school classrooms for students classified as Emotionally Disturbed 
•Provided behavioral interventions, wrote Functional Behavior Assessments and Behavior Plans
•Leader of Student Success Team, facilitate SST meetings with parents and staff to problem solve student concerns
profile_positions.title: School Social Worker

profile_positions.description:
Special Education IEP Facilitator, School Social Worker 
•Mental Health Department Chair, mentor for new employees and field liaison for social work interns
•Conducted new teacher trainings, trainings on PBS, child abuse, and behavioral interventions in the classroom 
•Provided individual and group therapy for students
•Facilitated IEP meetings, completed social emotional portions of IEP
•Administered BASC and ABAS –II evaluations
•Lead District Behavior Team in district wide trainings for teachers working with students with challenging behaviors
profile_positions.title: School Social Worker
